DataElement.preferredName: Amendment Change Summary Document Version Language Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A document, memo or brief that enumerates the differences between two versions of a study protocol document. OTHER NAME(S): Amendment NOTE(S): The term "Amendment" needs to be disambiguated since it sometimes refers to the amended version of the protocol (study protocol document version) and other times refers to the summary of changes (amendment change summary version) that are applied to a protocol to create a new version of the protocol. A coded value specifying the language that the document is written in. EXAMPLE(S): English, German. NOTE(S): Indicates the language in which all (or most) of discrete data elements that make up document are expressed. Distinct from data type attribute ED.languageCode on document version text attribute which expresses language in which document is rendered. Is most important in circumstances where document is not rendered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Amendment Change Summary Document Version Language Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds, symbols, or gestures.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: A systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds, symbols, or gestures.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds, symbols, or gestures.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Reference concept defined by a referenced code system.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
